_compel_init_t Struct Reference

COMPEL library initialization structure. This is used when you call script engine initialization function. More...

#include <compel_lib.h>

List of all members.

Public Attributes

bool b_usefullns
 Should the built-in extensions be registered with their full names?
bool b_dbgout_script
 Should the executed script lines be sent to debugger (as dbgout)?
const char * script_args
 The arguments passed to the script. You may access these arguments from the script using the $ARGS variable. The $ARGS.0 value is always set to the script's file name (if loaded from a file), or to "<string>" if script was loaded from a file.
const char * script_file
 The script's file name. If this is set, you later no need to specify the script file name in the "compel_script_load_file".
const char * extensions
 The desired built-in extensions you want to enable in the scripting engine. The extension names must be ; separated.
void * context
 User value, that can be later retrieved. It is considered as a tag.

Detailed Description

COMPEL library initialization structure. This is used when you call script engine initialization function.

See also:
compel_script_init()

Member Data Documentation

const char* _compel_init_t::extensions
 

The desired built-in extensions you want to enable in the scripting engine. The extension names must be ; separated.

See also:
compel_script_avail_extensions()

const char* _compel_init_t::script_file
 

The script's file name. If this is set, you later no need to specify the script file name in the "compel_script_load_file".

See also:
compel_script_load_file()
